Package com.pranab.playwithgraphs.datastructure

Interface MinPriorityHeap<K extends java.lang.Comparable<K>,​V>

Type Parameters:
K - - An comparable entity which is used to prioritize
V - - The Value that needs to be saved in collection identified by unique keys.
All Known Implementing Classes:
ArrayMinPriorityHeap
public interface MinPriorityHeap<K extends java.lang.Comparable<K>,​V>
The Object in the collection are prioritized on the basis of key provided against the object being stored in the collection.

Heap : is a special Tree-based data structure in which the tree is a complete binary tree

Min Heap : In a Min-Heap the key present at the root node must be minimum among the keys present at all of itâ€™s children. The same property must be recursively true for all sub-trees in that Binary Tree.

Author:
Pranab Bharadwaj

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    V extractMin()
    Extracts the objects identified by the minimum key among all the keys stored in the collection.
    void functionalIterator​(java.util.function.Consumer<HeapNode<K,​V>> function)
    an iterator to iterate through every element and execute the action passed on every element.
    int getIndex​(K key, V value)
    get the index of the value stored in the collection.
    void increasePriority​(int index, K newKey)
    Increases the priority of a specific object for early processing.
    void insert​(K key, V value)
    Inserts an object into the collection.
    V peek()
    provides the element with lowest key value without removing it from the heap.
    int size()
    The size of collection

  • Method Details

    • extractMin

      V extractMin()
      Extracts the objects identified by the minimum key among all the keys stored in the collection.
      Returns:
      the object stored against the minimum key.

    • increasePriority

      void increasePriority​(int index, K newKey)
      Increases the priority of a specific object for early processing. Note : In min-heap increasing priority leads to decrease in value of key
      Parameters:
      index - - current index of the key
      newKey - - new value of the key with increased priority

    • insert

      void insert​(K key, V value)
      Inserts an object into the collection.
      Parameters:
      key - - A key to uniquely identify the Object
      value - - The object which needs to be maintained in the collection

    • size

      int size()
      The size of collection
      Returns:
      Integer value depicting the current capacity

    • getIndex

      int getIndex​(K key, V value)
      get the index of the value stored in the collection.
      Parameters:
      key - - the key of the node.
      value - - the value of the node.
      Returns:
      the index of the key

    • functionalIterator

      void functionalIterator​(java.util.function.Consumer<HeapNode<K,​V>> function)
      an iterator to iterate through every element and execute the action passed on every element.
      Parameters:
      function - the action that needs to be performed

    • peek

      V peek()
      provides the element with lowest key value without removing it from the heap.
      Returns:
      the object with minimum key value.
